answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Jeffrey, 
Unfortunately I don't know where you can get a bridge that matches your desired characteristics although you can always check municibid to see if any bridges are coming up for auction. 
I was able to find a previously asked question that discusses creating funding options for local government building projects that may give you some ideas. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/22435/Park_and_Recreation_Question?pub=107&issue=2.26.2013&utm_source=ICMA+Leadership+Matters+(Nonmember+Edition)&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2.26.2013
I hope this is useful to you and that someone else is able to chime in and either give you some bridge advice or advice on solving a similar question. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
Hi Jeff:  I would suggest talking with area snowmobile clubs.  They build and install bridges all the time on a budget.  They may also have ideas about used bridges that are availalble.


Hi Jeff:  I would suggest talking with area snowmobile clubs.  They build and install bridges all the time on a budget.  They may also have ideas about used bridges that are availalble.

author: Jeffrey French
text:
The City of Barron is located in the geographic center of Barron County and has a beautiful park with a river transecting the park.  A coalition of; City of Barron, County of Barron, individuals and local Civic Clubs are working to install a pedestrian bridge across the river in the City Park.  This pedestrian bridge needs to be, at minimum 105ft in length, with a preferred width of 6ft.    
My question is this;  can you help me please in how we can secure the needed bridge without having to spend "big-bucks".  Would anyone have something that could work?  We currently have a bridge about 50ft in length, does anyone have an extra bridge?  Ideas on how to construct a bridge economically?  If you had a bridge in pieces, in the correct length, we possibly would have transportation to move it to Barron.
Please respond to jeff.french@co.barron.wi.us, or 715-537-6840.
THANK-YOU!! for any help you can provide!!
title: Pedestrian Bridge
